author: bnicholes
msg: Reimplemented apr_proc_create() on NetWare to use the new processve()
function rather than the NXVmSpawn() stuff.

author: bnicholes
msg: Reimplemented apr_file_pipe_create() on NetWare using the standard
pipe() function.

author: jwoolley
msg: Added --with-devrandom=[DEV] configure flag which allows a particular
"/dev/random"-compatible device to be specified, overriding the
default search path (/dev/random then /dev/arandom then /dev/urandom).
Also, if --with-egd=<path> is specified, it now implies
--without-devrandom.

author: striker
msg: The 'reuse' patch.  This will make pools a bit more carefull about
when it has to allocate a new block from the allocator.  If it has
an old block which can hold the allocation it allocates from that
and makes it the active block.
See: <86off8rtmp.fsf@kepler.ch.collab.net> for why we need it.
And: <1022371367.23007.13.camel@mypc1.pacbell.net> for a
benchmark showing it doesn't affect httpd performance.

author: striker
msg: The hi free patch.  This will add the ability for a developer to
set a maximum on the free blocks in an allocators freelist.
See: <86off8rtmp.fsf@kepler.ch.collab.net> for why we need it.
And: <1022371367.23007.13.camel@mypc1.pacbell.net> for a
benchmark showing it doesn't affect httpd performance.
